instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: 820 -3437 - B, spin but no chime no picture after liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi
Another Air, liquid ingress present in one area only, blob stretching from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>  down to <CHIP>U7870</CHIP> and to Y1915. It was dead ( just one wire circuit working) Cleaned it up with crest and I am getting spin but no chime nor picture. Nothing really pops up, all bits look good/shiny
Please assist :)
Thanks!

threads.title: 820 -3437 - B, spin but no chime no picture after liquid damage
threads.message:
All voltages present, including VCORE?
What about pins 3 & 7 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors.
Clean J6100, remove it if needed.
Try new BIOS also.

threads.message:
Hi

<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> 
3 - 0.5v
7 - 1.21v

5v present
3.3 v present
1.05v - reads 0.39v

J6100 looks super clean

SPI Bus Series Termination resistors - I tried googling those but cant seem to find any relevant info - please point me in the right direction

Thank you for your assistance

threads.title: 820 -3437 - B, spin but no chime no picture after liquid damage
threads.message:
Ok so all the SPI Bus Series Termination resistors have values as per schematics

<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> 

3 - 0.162v up and down a bit
7 - 0.168v then up to 0.190v then down again

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.59v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> -  3.42v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>  - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.4 v - changed <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> thinkink that this is the problem but still 0.4v :/ ( I am guessing this hopefully points towards an issue?)

threads.title: 820 -3437 - B, spin but no chime no picture after liquid damage
threads.message:
So the board stays on?
Post voltage of all coils.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> stays high?

"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 5v"
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> comes on stable?
